item.title: Sneaky micro-procrastination
item.description: Recently, it has crept back into my life: when waiting for a website to load, I’d open the email app to see if there’s anything new (and hopefully interesting) waiting in the inbox.

item.title: Little envy
item.description: People who journal, they make my eyes green. A person I know kept a journal when he was still at school.

item.title: Finally 30
item.description: Today I’ve officially lived 30 years on what Carl Sagan called a pale blue dot. Hence this piece of writing where I will jot down a few thoughts.

item.title: On my biggest boobs
item.description: Yeah, you read that right. And if you were taken aback, it means you may not have fully explored all the meanings of boobs (theyâ€™re not just menâ€™s hopes and dreams.

item.title: The Joy of Reading on the Kindle
item.description: The Kindle is a blessing. Whenever I tell someone that I love reading on the Kindle, the usual response is “I prefer paper books because I can feel the page and enjoy the pleasing scent of real paper.

item.title: Dude vs. man
item.description: Drax the Destroyer: He is not a dude. Youâ€™re a dude. Thisâ€¦ is a man. A handsome, muscular man.

item.title: Eye to eye
item.description: When giving advice, we often say if I were you, I would blah blah blah. But can I be you? The thing is, if I really am you, I would do the same thing youâ€™d do originally and that renders my advice redundant.

item.title: Old friends
item.description: Whenever I happen to hear a piece of music that I used to listen to for a long stretch of time â€” be it a movie soundtrack or a song that I associated with my crush â€” everything comes back, torrentially so.
